name: UpdateDatabaseWithDbUp
description: DbUp is a .NET library that helps you to deploy changes to SQL Server databases. It tracks which SQL scripts have been run already, and runs the change scripts that are needed to get your database up to date.
author: Johan Classon

inputs.name: ConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: The connection string to the database where the scripts should run on.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: Script Folder Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fodler path where all scripts which should be run are located.

inputs.name: JournalToSqlTable
inputs.label: Journal To SQL Table
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the scripts should be journaled in a SQL table. Not journaled scripts will be run each time.

inputs.name: ScriptFileFilter
inputs.label: Script File Filter
inputs.helpMarkDown: If only some of the scripts in the script folder path should be run. For example if jornaled scripts are named 201601011213-script_description.sql and the not journaled scripts are named everytime-script_description.sql, set the filet to ^everytime to target just the not journaled scripts.

inputs.name: TransactionStrategy
inputs.label: Transaction Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select No Transactions if you want to have manual control over the transactions through the content of the SQL scripts.
